problem.markdown:
1. The main function of substations are
() To decrease the voltage to a value appropriate for local distribution (x) All () To receive energy transmitted at high voltage from the generating stations () To provide switching facilities
2. A circuit breaker is an automatically operated electrical switch designed to protect an electrical circuit from damage caused by ________.
() Overhead () Short circuit (x) Both overhead and short circuit () None of the them
3. Substations generally have
() Switching and protection equipment () Transformers () Control equipment () All
4. SF6 circuit breaker is ________
() Expensive () SF6 gas has to be reconditioned after every operation of the breaker and additional equipment is required for these purposes (x) Both expensive and SF6 gas has to be reconditioned after every operation of the breaker and additional equipment is required for these purposes () None
5. The important characteristics of the fluid used in Circuit Breaker are :-
() It should have high dielectric strength and are extinguishing ability () It should have good thermal and chemical stability () Non- inflammability and high thermal conductivity (x) All
problem.p: 1. The main function of substations are

choicegroup.choice: To decrease the voltage to a value appropriate for local distribution
To receive energy transmitted at high voltage from the generating stations

problem.p: 2. A circuit breaker is an automatically operated electrical switch designed to protect an electrical circuit from damage caused by ________.

choicegroup.choice: SF6 gas has to be reconditioned after every operation of the breaker and additional equipment is required for these purposes
Both expensive and SF6 gas has to be reconditioned after every operation of the breaker and additional equipment is required for these purposes

problem.p: 5. The important characteristics of the fluid used in Circuit Breaker are :-

choicegroup.choice: It should have high dielectric strength and are extinguishing ability
It should have good thermal and chemical stability
Non- inflammability and high thermal conductivity
